manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: We take pride in manufacturing the highest quality dash cam adapters. Unlike many adapters that involve routing wires around your car (or worse – leaving them dangling across your windshield), Dongar adapters plug directly into your rearview mirror, ensuring a hassle-free setup and distraction-free driving for you.

Install as easy as 1...2...3 Check your compatibility Before ordering, confirm your vehicle's compatibility by using our compatibility chart. Plug in the adapter Installation is simple! With your vehicle turned off, simply unplug the power source from your rearview mirror and replace it with the Dongar Dash Cam Power Adapter. To do this you can depress the plastic push tabs on the connector and unplug it from the mirror. Dual power design Once your adapter is connected to your mirror, plug both your Dash Cam and original power source into the adapter. Our dual power design provides power to both your dash cam and your mirror.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worked perfect for 2020 Impreza with Eyesight but NO autodim mirror
reviews.reviewText: My impreza has eyesight but does not have the autodim mirror. After some research, I realized that subaru left the connection for the mirror in the overhead dash in case the buyer wanted to ever upgrade the mirror. I researched online how to open it up and sure enough I found an empty plug for the mirror. I plugged in this donger attachment to that plug and it worked perfectly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Confirmed to work with 2018 Outback
reviews.reviewText: I was surprised this showed up as quickly as it did. USPS gave no updates from the time the label was created, but was in my hands 4 days after I ordered it!I got this to wire my dashcam in my 2018 Subaru Outback Premium with Homelink and without eyesight. Upon opening the box, I wasn't sure if I got the right part since it didn't look like the part on the listing, and didn't look like the picture on the box... but it appeared to all be intact.Dropping the map light console takes about 3 seconds, and the connector for the mirror was right there. I was able to plug in the adapter very easily, and with having the separate power cord, was able to hook it up and run the wiring easily. My camera uses a USB mini B cord, which was included with the packaging (as well as the cords for USB Micro B and USB C connectors). Each cord was about 8", which gives some good flexibility to be able to hide wires easily.Before closing everything up, I tested the power by turning on the engine and my camera powered up flawlessly.Overall, il very happy with this adapter. Took about 10 minutes total to fully install and test out, and no longer need to have a power cable running up the A pillar to use my dashcam! Highly recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2021
reviews.reviewText: No sirvió, tenía gran espectativa hace el puente de energía pero no pasa corriente al usb gran deseccion pesimo debería ir sin ninguna estrella

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best way to power a dashcam!
reviews.reviewText: This made installing a dashcam in my 2019 Subaru Forester a snap! I had to pull down the light housing and find the mirror plug. The rest was easy. I highly recommend this adaptor!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great way to hide your cables and power up your dash cam!
reviews.reviewText: Install for the actual device is very simple, just plug it into the existing powered mirror port. The dash cam I have powered right up once plugged in so everything seems to be working.Using this will require some work for anyone with Subaru Eyesight to access the plug. There are instructions online you can find on how to do this.The plug unit may require a slight shimmy to make sure everything settles into a place that is not in the way but once done.When you are plugging in this unit, have at the ready any of the cords you will plug in and run along the header so you can put everything in and button up your work all at once.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super Easy to Install
reviews.reviewText: Just installed in my 2019 Forester Sport. Very easy. Took 20 minutes max. I have the Garmin 47 Dash Cam. Ran the cable under the auto-diming mirror wire harness cover that runs from the auto-dimming mirror mounting (on the windshield) up into the overhead console. Check out available videos for installation. My auto-dimming mirror was factory installed and required the 5-pin connector.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Know where to plug it in
reviews.reviewText: Works great, once you find the right connection. Just behind the Forester’s headliner, there is an electrical connector wrapped in black. This is the one you need. Don’t use the one for the airbag light. It won’t work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Not compatible with my 2020 Forester as advertised
reviews.reviewText: The connector matches with my 2020 Forester Limited. I was able to plug it in with no issue. However, there was no USB power. Upon looking closer at the adapter, I noticed that the power uses the middle wire and one next to it. In my vehicle there is no middle wire from the car entering the harness. So either the ground or the 12V Acc is missing. Perhaps this works with previous years, or maybe a different trim level, but not in ours.
